title: This scenario please: like Windows Remote Desktop (fullscreen/taskbar) but with WOL and systray menu?
author: m-7761
body_snippet: FWIW I'm hoping for more-or-less a wrapper around regular Windows Remote Desktop that's just more productive, so I don't have to go through the multiple clicks to connect, also requiring using a third-party WoL tool when the computer is off. Something like being able to make a shortcut with a command line would be ideal, or a systray app that pulls up a menu (nice for monitoring but more clicks and less flexible than a shortcut would be.) Probably a clever script could do all this without the ce...

iterations.description: The user is requesting new features including Wake-on-LAN and a system tray menu for connections, combined with existing RDP functionality.

It works well for me, no any black bar.

> WolCmd.exe

I do this by Apple HomeKit: 

1. In bios set the `Restore on AC Power Loss` to `Power ON`
2. buy a wifi socket for PC.
3. then you can power on your PC by homekit remotely
